group_siblings.title: Aerobicide
group_siblings.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audo

results.title: Aerobicide
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audo
results.brief_description:
Set against a backdrop of a woman singing and the constant image of a woman’s legs in energetic cycling movements, a room full of men attempt to cultivate female
trends but are ultimately unsuccessful. The energy of the women in this short music clip, singing and exercising is a stark contrast to the inertia of the males around them.
results.description:

results.title: On the gunline
results.creator_credit: Supreme Films and Department of the Navy
results.brief_description: The Australian guided missile destroyer HMAS Perth at war in Vietnam. Shows the routine of war for the officers and men, self maintenance and preparations at the U.S. Navy base at Subic Bay in the Philippines, underway replenishment of fuel and ammunition and action on the gunline off South Vietnam.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Supreme Films and Department of the Navy
results.description: The Australian guided missile destroyer HMAS Perth at war in Vietnam. Shows the routine of war for the officers and men, self maintenance and preparations at the U.S. Navy base at Subic Bay in the Philippines, underway replenishment of fuel and ammunition and action on the gunline off South Vietnam.
description_for_label: The Australian guided missile destroyer HMAS Perth at war in Vietnam. Shows the routine of war for the officers and men, self maintenance and preparations at the U.S. Navy base at Subic Bay in the Philippines, underway replenishment of fuel and ammunition and action on the gunline off South Vietnam.

results.title: One Day Soon
results.brief_description: A production that shows how handicapped people can live independent lives and how they cope with their unique situation. This video has won the Television Society Penguin Award and the Mobile Award.
results.description: A production that shows how handicapped people can live independent lives and how they cope with their unique situation. This video has won the Television Society Penguin Award and the Mobile Award.
